trans-unit.source: Provides data for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.AuthorizeWebPart"></xref> event.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.AuthorizeWebPart> event occurs before a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> control is added to a page.
There are a number of common scenarios where a control can be added to a page.
For a full description of these, see the Remarks section for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.IsAuthorized%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
The WebPartAuthorizationEventArgs class provides access to properties about the Web Parts control being added to the page.

When a control is added, it must be checked to see whether its <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart.AuthorizationFilter%2A> property has been set and, if so, whether the control is authorized to be added to the page.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartAuthorizationEventArgs"></xref> class.
The <xref:System.Type> of the control being checked for authorization.
The relative application path to the source file for the control being authorized, if the control is a user control.

An arbitrary string value assigned to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart.AuthorizationFilter*> property of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart"></xref> control, used for authorizing whether a control can be added to a page.

Indicates whether the control being checked for authorization is a shared control, meaning that it is visible to many or all users of the application, and its <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart.IsShared*> property value is set to <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.

Gets the string value assigned to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart.AuthorizationFilter*> property of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart"></xref> control, used for authorizing whether a control can be added to a page.
A <xref:System.String> used in determining whether a control is authorized to be added to a page.
Gets or sets the value indicating whether a Web Parts control can be added to a page.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the Web Parts control can be added to the page; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value that indicates whether a Web Parts control is visible to all users of a Web Parts page.
A shared Web Parts control is visible to all users of a Web page.
The opposite of a shared control is a per-user control, which is user-specific and is visible only to the user who added that control to the page.
If a dynamic control is added while a user is viewing the page in shared personalization scope, the control will be shared.
If the control is added while the user is in user personalization scope, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart.IsShared%2A> property value for that control will be `false`.
For more information about shared and per-user controls, see [Web Parts Personalization Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the Web Parts control is visible to all users of the page; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets the relative application path to the source file for the control being authorized, if the control is a user control.
A <xref:System.String> containing the relative application path.
Gets the <xref:System.Type> of the Web Parts control being checked for authorization.
The <xref:System.Type> of the control being checked for authorization.
